docs.lead_paragraph: A prominent conservative judge endorsed the constitutionality of the law. If the Supreme Court takes up the issue, it should do the same.
docs.abstract: Editorial holds that if Supreme Court agrees to hear arguments on constitutionality of health care reform, it should affirm rulings of prominent conservative judges like Laurence Silberman, who concluded that law's core element of mandatory health coverage is constitutional.
docs.snippet: A prominent conservative judge endorsed the constitutionality of the law. If the Supreme Court takes up the issue, it should do the same.

docs.lead_paragraph: The struggling New York City Opera will mostly rely on donated income, not ticket sales, for many years.

headline.main: Trustee Cuts 1,066 Jobs at MF Global; CME Pledges Backing for Customers

docs.abstract: The CME Group, the exchange where MF Global did most of its business, has taken the unusual step of pledging $300 million to the bankruptcy trustee to help the firm's beleaguered customers.
docs.snippet: The CME Group, the exchange where MF Global did most of its business, has taken the unusual step of pledging $300 million to the bankruptcy trustee to help the firm's beleaguered customers.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED and BEN PROTESS

docs.lead_paragraph: The court-appointed trustee overseeing the liquidation of MF Global's brokerage unit laid off 1,066 employees on Friday, the biggest wave of job cuts at the firm since it collapsed into bankruptcy nearly two weeks ago.

headline.main: Trustee Cuts 1,066 Jobs at MF Global; CME Pledges Backing for Customers

docs.lead_paragraph: William F. Boyland Jr., a Brooklyn Democrat, was found not guilty of conspiring to take thousands of dollars in bribes for using his influence on behalf of a health care organization.

headline.seo: Assemblyman Boyland Acquitted in Bribery Case
headline.main: Jury Acquits Assemblyman of Conspiring to Take Bribes
headline.print_headline: Jury Acquits Assemblyman Of Conspiring to Take Bribes

docs.abstract: New York State Assemblyman William F Boyland Jr of Brooklyn is found not guilty of conspiring to take $175,000 dollars in bribes for using his influence on behalf of Medisys, a health care organization that runs hospitals in Queens and Brooklyn.
docs.snippet: William F. Boyland Jr., a Brooklyn Democrat, was found not guilty of conspiring to take thousands of dollars in bribes for using his influence on behalf of a health care organization.

headline.main: How Obama Can Win Ohio Again

docs.abstract: The pro-union vote is there to be had, but it is not a gimme.
docs.snippet: The pro-union vote is there to be had, but it is not a gimme.

docs.lead_paragraph: The decisive referendum vote to repeal the bill that would limit collective bargaining by public sector unions has changed the political landscape in Ohio. Tuesday's vote on Senate Bill 5 could and should be a harbinger for the 2012 presidential election. By mounting a direct assault on public sector workers and the unions who represent them, Gov. John R. Kasich of Ohio may have done more to help Barack Obama win re-election than anything Obama's political team is likely to do over the next 12 months.

headline.main: How Obama Can Win Ohio Again

docs.abstract: The pro-union vote is there to be had, but it is not a gimme.
docs.snippet: The pro-union vote is there to be had, but it is not a gimme.
